alert.note: Alert for Barron; Polk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Barron and eastern Polk Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 400 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Hertel to Amery. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Clear Lake around 415 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cumberland, Prairie Farm, Haugen and Rice Lake. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 53 between mile markers 140 and 152. U.S. Highway 61 near mile marker 165. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.
